intro: Sida chubutensis, commonly known as the Chubut morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in the morning, giving it its common name. Sida chubutensis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
